revised_title: Investigation of the Effect of Electricity on the Shortening of Wires
tldr: The author, Edward Nairne, demonstrates that electricity can cause iron wires to shorten in length when an electrical charge is passed through them. He conducts multiple experiments, showing that the wires shorten by a consistent proportion with each discharge of the battery. The phenomenon is not observed when the wire is heated to red-hot, suggesting that the shortening is due to the effect of electricity rather than heat.
